alert.note: Alert for Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 7:39PM CDT until May 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Colorado, Fort Bend, Wharton and Austin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River near Sweeny. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water is over the mid level walkway at the Phillips Terminal near Sweeny. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday morning to a crest of 8.6 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.4 feet on 12/14/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River Sweeny 7.0 6.5 Tue 6 pm CDT 6.0 8.2 8.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 145 PM CDT.
